page.title: 01Longstone Edge to Calver.
page.content: This is an area of hills and valleys lying between three villages in the Peak District National Park -Great Longstone, Calver and Stoney Middleton. It is limestone country, with rough stone walls, isolated farms and mining -both current and worked out -as its principal features. The land rises from 140 metres at its lowest point to 391 metres at the trigonometrical point on Longstone Moor. Metalled roads border the south, east and north sides and most commerce and habitations are located on them, although only two hamlets -Hassop and Rowland -are actually contained within the block. The farming land is almost entirely rough grazing, used for rearing cattle and sheep.
